title: New Scenic Self-Drive Routes to Discover
content:
Balkan Peninsula Loop Tour

Route: Starting from Dubrovnik, Croatia, passing through countries such as Montenegro, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia, Bulgaria, Romania, etc., and finally returning to Croatia. This route allows you to experience the rich historical culture and diverse natural scenery of the Balkan Peninsula.

Scenic highlights:

In Croatia, you can stroll on the ancient walls of Dubrovnik, overlooking the beautiful painting of the Adriatic Sea's azure waters and red roofed houses. You can also visit Split, visit the Diocletian Palace, and experience the splendor of ancient Roman times.

The scenery of Kotor Bay in Montenegro is magnificent, and the small towns inside the bay are peaceful and quaint. Behind them are towering mountains that complement the clear waters.

Sarajevo in Bosnia and Herzegovina is a city full of historical charm, with attractions such as the Latin Bridge and the Old Town witnessing the city's vicissitudes and changes.

Belgrade, Serbia has a lively urban atmosphere, and Kalemegdan Castle is a great place to overlook the city scenery.

The Lira Monastery in Bulgaria is hidden among the mountains and forests, with a unique architectural style and breathtaking natural scenery around it.

The Transylvania region of Romania is full of mystery, with spectacular castles and beautiful rural scenery.



Nordic Aurora Tour

Route: Departing from Helsinki, Finland, heading towards Rovaniemi, then entering Troms ø, Norway, and finally arriving at Abisko, Sweden. This is a dream route to pursue the aurora, while also enjoying the unique ice and snow scenery of Northern Europe.

Scenic highlights:

Helsinki is a city that combines modernity and tradition, with beautiful architecture and seaside scenery. In Rovaniemi, you can visit Santa Claus Village, take photos with Santa Claus, and experience activities such as reindeer sledding.

Troms ø in Norway is located within the Arctic Circle and is one of the best places to observe auroras. At night, the aurora dances brilliantly in the sky, while during the day, one can enjoy magnificent scenery such as fjords and snow capped mountains.

Sweden's Abisko National Park has a pure natural environment, with lakes, forests, and mountains intertwined, making it a great place for outdoor activities such as hiking and skiing.



Journey to the western coast of Portugal and Spain

Route: Starting from Lisbon, Portugal, driving north along the western coast of Portugal, passing through Porto, then entering the Galicia region of Spain, and finally arriving at Santiago de Compostela. This route allows you to experience the charming scenery and profound cultural heritage of the western coast of the Iberian Peninsula.

Scenic highlights:

Lisbon is a vibrant city with ancient trams, spectacular castles, and beautiful beaches. There are many beautiful towns and fishing villages on the western coast of Portugal, such as Sintra and Cascais, with unique architectural styles and picturesque scenery.

Porto is the second largest city in Portugal, renowned for its wine and beautiful architecture. You can visit the Port wine cellar, taste delicious wines, and enjoy the beautiful scenery on both sides of the Douro River.

The Galicia region of Spain has spectacular coastlines and dense forests, as well as many historic towns and villages such as La Coru ñ a and Vigo.

Santiago de Compostela is one of the holy sites of Christianity, with a large number of pilgrims coming every year. The cathedrals in the city are masterpieces of architectural art, and the surrounding streets are filled with a strong religious atmosphere.



Self driving tour of Hokkaido, Japan

Route: Departing from Sapporo, heading towards Otaru, Asahikawa, Furano, Meiying and other places, and finally returning to Sapporo. Hokkaido is a northern island of Japan, with vast grasslands, magnificent mountains, and beautiful flower seas, making it an ideal place for self driving tours.

Scenic highlights:

Sapporo is the capital of Hokkaido, with bustling commercial streets and delicious cuisine. You can visit attractions such as Sapporo TV Tower and Datong Park to experience the charm of this city.

Otaru is a city full of romantic atmosphere, with buildings on both sides of the canal filled with European style, as well as many exquisite handicraft shops and cafes.

Asahikawa is famous for Asahiyama Zoo, where you can see cute animals such as penguins and polar bears.

Furano and Meiying are flower destinations in Hokkaido, where lavender, sunflowers, and other flowers bloom in the summer, creating a beautiful colorful picture.



Tour around Tasmania Island, Australia

Route: Starting from Hobart, travel clockwise or counterclockwise along the coastline of Tasmania Island, passing through attractions such as Launceston, Cradle Hill, and Glass Bay, and finally returning to Hobart. Tasmania is an island state in Australia, with pristine natural scenery and abundant wildlife.

Scenic highlights:

Hobart is the capital of Tasmania, with beautiful coastal scenery and historic buildings. You can visit attractions such as Salamanca Square and Hobart Port, and also taste fresh seafood.

Launceston is the second largest city in Tasmania, with many ancient buildings and beautiful gardens. You can visit attractions such as Cardnet Canyon and Tama Valley to experience the charm of nature.

Cradle Mountain is one of the famous attractions in Tasmania, with spectacular mountains, clear lakes, and dense forests, making it a great place for hiking.

Glass Bay is one of the most beautiful bays in Tasmania, with crystal clear waters and pristine beaches. The surrounding mountains and forests form a beautiful backdrop.
section: Self driving tours allow you to freely explore every corner and stop your car to appreciate the beautiful scenery that only drivers can discover. Along the way, you may pass through quiet mountain paths, winding riverside roads, or magnificent coastlines, each scenery full of unique charm and surprises. You can stop and take photos, take a walk as you please, and feel the tranquility and beauty of nature.
